thread.title: Chicago Pizza Summit returns; tickets on sale this week
thread.title_full: Chicago Pizza Summit returns; tickets on sale this week

author: Joseph Hernandez
title: Chicago Pizza Summit returns; tickets on sale this week
text:
Chicago Pizza Summit returns; tickets on sale this week Chicago Pizza Summit 
Get your cheese on at Chicago Pizza Summit. 
Get your cheese on at Chicago Pizza Summit. Joseph Hernandez U.S. Pizza Museum firing up in Chicago 
Chicagoan Kendall Bruns, founder of the U.S. Pizza Museum, shows some items from the collection. (Bill Daley / Chicago Tribune) 
Chicagoan Kendall Bruns, founder of the U.S. Pizza Museum, shows some items from the collection. (Bill Daley / Chicago Tribune) See more videos 
Entertainment besides all-you-can-eat pizza: The U.S. Pizza Museum is returning with a pop-up exhibit, and fest organizers are introducing what they're calling The Pizza Olympics, hosted by local rapper and emcee Show You Suck. The public can compete in a slice-eating contest (watch for sign-up to begin in a few weeks), and industry members will face off in dough-tossing and pizza-box-folding competitions. 
Last yearâ€™s Pizza Summit featured a surprise guest, musician and self-styled "King of Partying" Andrew W.K. This year? Spina remained mum on what surprises are in store. Over the next couple of weeks, expect organizers to tease more events and names of participating restaurants across Old Style's social media channels (@oldstylebeer). 
The one-day event, held at Chop Shop in Wicker Park (2033 W. North Ave.), is organized in partnership with Empty Bottle Presents. Tickets ($35) include all-you-can-eat pizza, five beer tickets good for Old Style or Old Style Light beer, and an Old Style pizza-shaped plate. The first session will run from 2 to 5 p.m.; the second session from 6 to 9 p.m. 
Tickets go on sale at www.emptybottle.com on Thursday, Feb. 9 beginning at noon. Last year, they sold out in less than an hour. 
jbhernandez@chicagotribune.com Twitter @joeybear85
